this yoga practice has made me realise so much about my body and health. Because of covid I have been working on my computer and studying 7 hrs regularly without much outdoor time. I developed severe neck pain and upon x-ray, my neck spine has straightened. I have had neck and shoulder pain for months now. I tried various exercises but I could not find the right way to do yoga and truly rejuvenate my body until I found this channel. While doing this practice, I found out how much of my flexibility I've lost. Like, while doing the tabletop position my wrists could not hold up, and I'm only 17. This is helping me in tremendous ways and transforming my lifestyle for the better.

I'm so grateful for this channel for providing such quality yoga practice free of cost. I wish Adriene and everyone reading this all the best. God bless.

I was intimidated by the length of the video since I hadnâ€™t done yoga consistently for a while. Iâ€™m so glad I did it anyway. I struggle a lot with dissociating and depersonalization, and your yoga practices help me so much to be present in my body, to forgive myself, to love myself. Last year I did it much more consistently, and it helped me heal from an eating disorder Iâ€™d had for a decade for that reason. I was able to be present in my body, ask for forgiveness and give forgiveness. I recently was diagnosed with bipolar, and I am trying to start my practice again, because I have been so overwhelmed and angry with my mind and body again. I feel angry that the depression I felt isnâ€™t going to go away. But yoga reminds me so much to be gentle, to forgive, and to be in this moment. At the end of this video, when we were in corpse pose, I heard the birds outside my window, and I really heard them, as well as feeling my own breath. Itâ€™s the most present Iâ€™ve felt in so long and I just started crying because I felt like I had come home. Thank you for all you do and the work you do to help heal people with your spirit of gentleness, and introducing yoga in an approachable and inclusive way. Thank you so much.

Hi! I'm from the future (day 16) and I wanted to share my (summarized) experience with this journey so far. I'm gonna copy paste a comment I posted on day 15 in case someone needs a bit of motivation:

â€œI noticed how has my body and mind had changed since I started this journey. I feel better, calmer. I don't get angry so easily, and I'm more aware of my body. I think I look prettier than before, but I don't know if that's cause of the yoga itself or it's me that's changing. My shoulders are a bit sore, but I feel stronger. It's easier for me to sit with my back straight (because I'm an artist and I spend hours hunched over the table, painting or drawing) and this is helping me a lot with that. Now I'm more cheerful than before. Today I found myself dancing and singing alone in the kitchen while doing the dishes, smiling and feeling so energetic! I love this feeling. I think that now I'm gonna add this beautiful and wholesome habit to my daily routine for the rest of my life, cause this is absolutely perfect for my mind and body. Every time I finish one practice, I look forward to the next one.â€

Funnily enough, I felt a fair amount of aggression after finishing this practice. The aggro mentality came from my mind persisting to want to rushing through, feeling impatient and frustrated. Afterwards, I took a beat, gave myself some time to think on my feelings, and accept them for what they are. So while it may have felt frustrating in the moment, I'm really thankful that you hold space for every range of emotion that may come out, and allow us to take the time to work through those feelings.

I am on Day 22 now. This class was the start of a truly beautiful and life-changing journey. I'm all in Adriene! I'm looking forward to starting Bridge and Move, already have my calendars printed! It really feels so good to check in with yourself everyday. And the perspectives Adriene shares like finding the beauty in your current moment, in the life around you is honestly something that's saved me through my life.

I look forward to growing my strength in that aspect. I'm about Adriene's age, also half Mexican on my mom's side, and I've developed chronic pain and disorders over the past several years and it's been hard trying to find a new normal. I've used my breath and mindfulness as anchor in my life and practiced yoga and meditation through various means and in several classes but now I feel like now I've really found my path to grow in mindfulness and yoga. I've never found something that fit this well. The gentle power and welcoming environment of Adriene's classes lead by her calm, sweet guidance feels like I've found what I've been looking for. Thank you so very much!

For those who are not sure which to choose between Adrienne's and Tim's 30 challenges (My own opinion):
1. Both are amazing teachers. You will learn a lot.
2. Adriene's is more spiritual and mental. She highly encourages you to take your time and tune into your body. Hence a lot more breathing, positive affirmations, overall slowe and mindful moving. You will feel positive and balanced. Meditetitive.
3. Tim's is about more body building and conscious movement. He gives good advices about our body anatomy and how not to 'abuse' our body. Transitions are faster and more strength building oriented. You will feel energized and positive.

My advice: If you are new to yoga, I advise you to start with Adriane's and continue to Tim's. f you are pretty good at yoga, I would mix them day by day. Great variation of mind and body focus.

hi all! Just dropping this question here in case anyone more experienced has an answer. I'm a beginner at yoga and have had an on and off relationship with it. I'm slowly trying to create some consistency. What I noticed though in poses where the head is upside down is that blood from the rest of my body tends to rush down toward the head way too quickly for my liking, sometimes making me extremely dizzy. Is this a breath thing? Do I need to work with breath regulation more? Hope someone sees this! Cheers xx

@Carin G hi there, thanks for commenting. Yes, light headed and like my whole face fills with blood. Sometimes I feel like a tomato about to explodeğŸ˜‚ what you describe however used to happen to me too but because Adriene transitions slowly between poses, I don't experience it that much. I will look into orthostatic hypotension though.

When you say dizzy, do you mean light headed or spinning? I experience light headedness when coming up from being upside down. I have orthostatic hypotension which means my blood pressure drops as I stand up. I've come close to fainting! It's more likely to happen to me in the mornings. I seem to do better in the afternoons, and I've learned to take it very slowly and make sure I am breathing. I hope you find answers.

That was the longest practice I've ever done in my own space and completely chosen by me. I loved the gentle slowness of it! But those lunges were especially hard today! I sat on the ground for over three hours watching the Lord of the Rings (extended) with some friends last night, so I'm especially glad to work through some of the tightness from that haha! Sometimes deep breaths are hard. Anxious feelings and flutterings catch on the breath, making it more shallow and uneven. Syncing my breath with movement is so helpful for me to find greater space in my lungs and torso, and I think that is what drew me here. Also, I'm seeing so many comments saying they're late...but I think you're right on time! It is good for you _when_ever you are. That is how I feel, even though this is my first time doing one of the 30 journeys :-)

Just my perspective: Itâ€™s just making the movements your own, not just doing it rote. Itâ€™s not just raising your hands above your head because she told you to, but really noticing what youâ€™re doing, as youâ€™re doing it, what muscles are working, what changes if you twist your hand this way or that, or if you consciously relax your shoulders, ect. Itâ€™s the small, little movements and thoughts that take it from just stretching and breathing to practicing yoga. Hope that helps! Stick with it and youâ€™ll get it!

I did it. Day 1. I feel proud. It was more challenging than I thought it would be, taking it slow and being really intentional. Part of me is honestly scared of committing to the 30 days because if I don't complete it, "I'll feel shame and it will be evidence that I can't stick to a goal" (says the part that is afraid of failure and that equates my self worth with what I do or don't do). It would be a big shift from hardly doing any movement (other than walks) to 45 minutes of yoga EVERY DAY. And, I think, the research on building habits says to start small...like teeny tiny.

But what if I treated this like an experiment? How will it feel, what will I notice, what changes might arise if I did this thing I've never done before? It could be an opportunity to practice self-compassion, gently encouraging myself to step on the mat even when I don't want to. And cheering myself on to return to the mat if I miss a day for some reason (which is likely to happen). I've been wanting to get my body moving for a while now...so I'm going to try it.

Thanks for the opportunity to think that through! I'm grateful to Adriene and to all of you.

I love practicing with you .. & starting this series here is so encouraging. I was smiling when you told us to massage the palm of our hands as they were so red.. always feeling that they're barely enduring this pressure although am practicing for a while now. BIG THANK YOU for your sweet video & your lovely sense pf humor

just started this journey today and i feel so good about it! though i wanted to start this on the 1st, the beginning of this year started out pretty rough. from the end of 2020, my mindset for the new year was to "heal myself from everything from my past" and "manifest/grow into the person i want to be", to work even harder for the things that i want, but after breaking down every single day, i realized that i set up so many expectations for myself and had put too many things on my plate- in just 5 days! i don't want 2021 to just be huge to-do list, but i just wanted to change so bad and outgrow my old habits. but after talking things through with the people closest to me, i realized that healing/growth will come naturally- when you're fixated on just that, you miss out on enjoying the smallest moments. i'll heal and grow without even realizing it once i start enjoying life. today's practice definitely reminded me to "LET GO" and be present, to be mindful and patient. just wanted to share in case anyone was going through the same thing! i love this uplifting community so much that it made me want to share my experience- first time commenting on any youtube video lol, but we got this!

I really feel you. I usually do that same thing of making every year into a never-ending to-do list. I decided I didn't want that this year. As you said, enjoying life is what matters. If you've also come to this "late," you are not alone :) one of my mentors says "we are right where we are supposed to be."
I was introduced to YWA years ago. I would call myself a "lapsed yogi." A friend invited me to this yesterday, and while my initial thought was to be annoyed because "now I'm already 'behind'" it was so quickly followed by gratitude. I have been looking for a "good enough" reason to get moving with yoga again and a friend inviting me was perfect. I must say, I think this might be the first 30-day challenge where I sincerely want to commit, do every single day's vid. even if i skip a day of the week I will continue to the next so it might take me a while to get through this, maybe not all in a row, but that's ok... being gentle with myself.
I found it helpful to reach a bunch of the comments before partaking on this journey. I felt more inspired and like I could actually do this if so many others could. I especially loved reading about how so many people were able to commit based on one person sharing that they were surprised when they saw 48 minutes (super long for YWA) but did it anyway and felt amazing. It's really neat too to see so many people commenting and sharing from all around the world (hello to you from Pennsylvania, USA!) Thank you all for sharing your experiences.
Here are mine:
- did this before bed, and it was appropriate. I was concerned I would be too jazzed, but I'm feeling pretty zen RN. Like I could get ready for bed no prob.
- looooooooved that this one has a savasana. many YWA vids don't which is not my preference.
- about 33 minutes in I had to pause, I think I had too much fluid in my sinuses, (maybe due to lapsed yoga practice I haven't spent nearly that much time upside-down lately?) and got a sharp pain shooting up my forehead (but I made it through the rest of the practice just fine - breaks are good)
- one note of suggestion, that I hope gets enacted throughout the rest of the month's practices - I would love for the pauses, for the moments we are encouraged to breathe, to be a little more extended, so that I can actually focus on listening to myself breathe for a few breaths. By the time Adriene was talking again I had barely had a chance to do that, and so it felt a little rushed.
- Otherwise, I loved it and am really curious and excited to see where this takes me, and us as a community who are all partaking.

Thank you Adriene for making this so accessible! You are doing more than your fair share in helping to repair this broken world <3

This brings so much meaning to my life. To start this next journey with all you already brings a great store of transcendence that will carry me through the less than harmonious moments in this journey that I know will come, because everything is a wave. We have highs and we have lows, but lows make us more appreciative of the highs when we choose to tell ourselves this story. We ultimately have the power to decide our fates with everything or nothing we are given. I feel so blessed to have this freely given resource, the opportunity to develop this relationship with myself, our teacher, Adriene, and all of you developing together with me. Whether you practice day by day, a few days late like me, or stumble upon this weeks, months, or years from now, we are all in this together. We are all here, in our moment as we land on the mat, as one. This connection will follow us, moment to moment throughout our lives, often unacknowledged, but powerful and enduring nonetheless. The light in me acknowledges and desires nothing more than for you to find and cultivate the light in you. May 2021 bring meaning above all else. Namaste.

Thank you for creating this. You have no idea how many lives you are changing because you are providing the best form of education (self-awareness) for free. I started doing yoga with Adriene during the lockdown. I got lost after completing two and a half 30-day journeys cause life got in the way.

Last year, I applied for grad schools, took exams and suffered from anxiety. I remember thinking to myself how yoga has helped me with my flexibility and balance, but also my mental stability and health. Now, having my sh*t back on track, I try to find my precious time for yoga each morning.

But, even then, I would imagine how it would feel to do yoga with so many people at the same time. Now, my first new year resolution is doing yoga together with the Yoga with Adriene community! Who's with me for 30 days? ğŸ˜

I will be a proud part of this amazing and supportive community throughout our journey together! I cannot wait to inhale and exhale with you!

Something that I really thought about during this practice was patience. It has been really hard trying to be patient this past year. I want life to go back to normal so badly, but it is just out of my control. I LOVE these videos, but my knees do not. Are there some modifications for those of us with terrible knees?
@Rhonda Rogers ouch, yes modifying is your friend!

Thank you. I do pad when I'm down on the floor. I think it is the transition and holding sometimes. I have no cartilage left in either knee so the bones rub together.  I use blocks too when I can't quite reach the floor, but I may just need to find some other poses.

I'd pad your knees every time you can (towel or double up on your mat), not just when Adriene suggests it. I used to not even be able to kneel on my knees and with Adriene's videos (and time) I rarely have issues anymore.

When I do 27:30 my inner thighs tire out quickly and it's hard to maintain balance when raising my hands & looking up. Anyone knows of a complete beginner modification/video for this pose? (I'm not obese and have no medical conditions/disability, just generally physically unfit.)

Balance - make sure you're using your core, that you're engaging your legs, and keep your eyes fixed on something. It helps so much with balance. Hold it until you tire and then go to a resting pose like child's pose. You will get stronger and stronger over time :) Everyone starts out wobbly but with regular practice you will improve so much

Keep your hands on the ground and work on your foundation, you will be surprised how quickly you grow the strength. I'd also say watch how you are talking to yourself- instead of saying you are unfit, tell yourself your body hasn't learned how to do that yet ğŸ™ğŸ»

Like many people, I started a daily practice with adriene during spring, to find some way to deal with covid-related stress while trapped inside. My daily practice has made such a difference- reducing my back pain, strengthening my core, and giving me a little time to myself.

One thing I have learned is not to force anything. I remember this summer, I got frustrated that I was not getting flexible fast enough. I decided I wasn't try hard enough and pressed forward as hard as I could, until it was painful. Then I heard a pop and my back was sore for two weeks, lol. Today, when Adriene said to twist my wrist around I started doing it, only made it halfway and my wrists told me this was a no go. So I listened, and I happily did what I could. And I'm proud of myself, even if I'll never be the most flexible person.
Thank you!  Arms and Core are feeling heavy.

I looked at the length of this video and thought I couldn't possibly last the 48 minutes especially with anxiety about the time ticking the day away. However, I laid down my mat, hit play on the video, and just fully let go to the sound of adriene's voice and embraced every word, breath, and movement. I am thankful these yoga sequences are somehow so perfectly designed to nourish if we keep ourselves open to it because the time was able to fly by with happiness and peace rather than anxiety. This is both my thanks and a reminder to myself or anyone else to invite ease and openness to each yoga session or video because the journey is wonderful and personal and you are capable of each step, no matter how far you've stepped away.

Hello. In theÂ past I have considered myself more an avid trail runner and Qigong practitioner, having tried yoga only a few times in a gym. They have a yogaÂ teacher at my alternative public high school where I provide Special Education. I often sit on a yoga ball in class as do many of my students because it is so good forÂ your core in comparison to being at a traditional desk all day. However, since the pandemic began enjoying the outdoors for me has sometimes been a bit more challenging. I have tried various 30 day yoga challenges via Amazon since March 13, 2020 toÂ keep me healthy both in mind and body. Some I completed in 30 days, others I did not. It was not until late August 2020 that I discovered Yoga with Adriene. At first herÂ practice seemed too easy in comparison to the other challenges I had completed. I had read comments from otherÂ practitioners mentioning that they use Yoga with Adriene as a supplement and often add something else. However, every time I completed a different 30 day Yoga with Adriene, at the conclusion I have felt just right. For me not only has it ignited a passion for yoga, but it has brought something for me to share with others during these very uncertain and stressful times. Thank you Adriene and Benji, you have both converted me. I now also consider myself a daily yoga practitioner! I am sincerely looking forward to this journey every day in 2021. Namaste, Edward

Adriene reminded us that showing up to the mat would be one of the toughest parts - and she wasnâ€™t wrong! We were short staffed at the hospital last night, so I agreed to stay over into the night shift for four hours knowing I had to be back at work the next day. Iâ€™d gone home on my dinner break and prepared a breakfast I could take with me on the road the next day after this first video, set my alarms so I would wake up early enough to do this - Iâ€™d committed to give myself this gift. Then four am hit and my replacement still wasnâ€™t there after an hour and they were scrambling to find somebody to match me. I made it home, caught a few hours of sleep, and woke up just early enough to do this first video. All that to say, I am SO grateful I did. Groggy-eyed on the mat (which was just a blanket on my floor), this was the perfect pace I needed today. My soul feels refreshed and my body awake. I am calm and ready to begin another day! Thank you so much!

For anyone doing this for the first time and finding it impossibly hard, especially on the wrists, and wondering "what in the world is wrong with me?" please know that it will quickly get easier and you will be so surprised at your own determination and strength - stick with it! When I started doing yoga for the first time last year with HOME at the beginning of the lockdown, I could not understand why no one was commenting on how hard this was on your wrists but within a few days I was already noticing a wonderful difference and a real awareness in my new strengths!

I'm grateful to start the NY's off with this support and centering.  (Where do you find these beautiful rooms to film in?!!) SIMPLICITY.  I will start there-101 in everything that I do. From February to August last year I did yoga with Adriene every day, then when I went back to work in August  I very quickly stopped my daily practice. I only did yoga maybe a few times between then and now, but I knew I wanted to do the 30 day challenge. I have to say, it was definitely hard to show up today. I found myself thinking, maybe I'll do it in an hour, and I had to tell myself that if I didn't get on the mat right then it would never get done because one hour would turn into two, then I would be getting ready for bed and realize I never rolled out my mat at all. Showing up really is the hardest part. Once I heard Adriene's voice I was hooked in. It was lovely to hear her usual phrases and sayings (hey-oh!) and to feel my body naturally fall back into poses and rhythms it had learned for months previously. Although it's definitely harder to hold the poses for me now, and I found my body getting tired more quickly than it used to, I really enjoyed doing this practice. It's like hanging out with an old friend after months apart. While it was hard to initially show up, I'm definitely glad that I did, and look forward to showing up the rest of the month as well! Definitely dreading day 6 a bit though, haha!

You can't even imagine how many people you are impacting daily.I am one of those silent fans that never usually comment but I thought I need to let You know. Invite yourself to let go...I felt myself feeling frustrated. Adriene said to notice any clenching and I noticed it and thought, "Hellooooo, I am saying let gooooo" and it would not release. Felt the clenching, felt the itch on my forehead, and continued to breathe. I let go in my own way.

I'm dropping a comment here for anyone who tried this video and failed to let you know you aren't alone. I scrolled comments for a while trying to find commiseration and didn't see anyone else who was frustrated. My back locked up around minute 23, and I had to pause the video and figure out how to stretch myself so I could move again. I had a good cry and started again. But within minutes it was moving too quickly for me to follow and to understand what I was supposed to be doing. I never could figure out if my body was doing the right things. I'm a beginner, and I thought this would be good for beginners, but that was a mistake. On the night before New Year's Eve, my two year long toxic relationship ended. He broke it off with me after toying with my feelings, being indecisive if he wanted me, being controlling, and it broke my heart. I feel like I wasted my last years as a young adult on this man (for context: he is also 13 years older than me). Thank you, Adriene, for this. I am allowing myself to finally breathe and to open my eyes that I am worthy of love, I am worthy of friendship, and I am worthy of all things good. I sacrificed so much for that man and now I am on the path to healing. I am so excited to be on this journey with everyone.

This is all for you! Remember that your are worthy and amazing! Put yourself first! No time is wasted if you take the lessons it taught you and move forward. Much Love, stay strong, it was never about you, it was all his unresolved issues!

I'm journaling a few words or phrases that come up during each practice of this journey. Today was "Keep with it." I was thinking of all the times I've thought, 'Oh that's hard" or "wow that's uncomfortable" and collapse and wait for the practice to move onto something easier or more comfortable. But I also thought about all the things that used to be hard or uncomfortable that I can now do with ease, because for some reason I 'kept with' those things. It's supposed to be hard or uncomfortable... until it's not any more.

Thank you Adriene.  Until March of 2020 I had a very active yoga practice and rigorous daily workouts to the point that my body decided it was time to take a long break to recover. Finally, I surrendered and have been slowly rebuilding and coming to terms that it is OK to slow down and start over.  I decided to take on this 30 day Yoga Journey - BREATH to ease myself back into a consistent practice with calmer approach.  Thank you for this offering.

I'm very hypermobile (to the point dislocations are just a regulat thing- potential hEDS y'know... diagnosis takes a long time), faint often if I'm too active or upright too long, anxious and paranoid as it gets etc etc y'know the whole package- and haven't done yoga for a long time due to the way it was destabalising my joints and causing pain (originally it was what I was recommended as I had chronic pain, but as I've found it's due to hypermobility, I've been advised to stay away from it unless I stay aware of my joints), but I'm gonna try and do this yoga journey not just for breath but to maybe become more aware of how I move my body during exercise- something I miss after having to stop dancing and martial arts in my teenage years and would love to get more active now I'm in my 20s, and especially after the past year I've had, hopefully find a little tiny bit of peace. It was really difficult trying to be aware of my joints, aware of my breath, and trying to stay stable in any position, and I had to pause and rest often, if I found myself too shakey, amend my position if I found I was over extending my joints, alter poses to protect my fingers or knees, etc., but it's only day one, and thought it took me twice as long as the video is, I'll see how it goes. But it is quite difficult to find length and not overextend and that's something I hope I can get better at.

I have not been taking care of my â€œfussy wristsâ€.  Just hearing Adrienne refer to as fussy makes me feel so much better.  All is not lost!   It is a journey. I am going to slow down and take care of them, place more emphasis on core and lower body strength. It is okay that I am taking a step back from planks.  It is even more important to SHOW UP and listen to my body.

I've been trying to treat my wrists better the past six months or so and for me the most important thing is to just do SOMETHING intentional every day I can. An unusual rotation, a different stretch, even just focusing on hanging them limp! I also really identify with feeling "bad" if I miss a day, but I try to remind myself that no one is giving me a grade on it. Like Adriene says, it's just finding what feels good!

Best of luck on your journey friend!

I think it was about two years ago now, that you truly inspired me to invest in myself, invest in a mat and keep on showing up to it as often as possible.

At that time I had recently started to get out of a long period of illness that had me bedridden for a few years. I was tired, weak, depressed, overweight and desperate to find back to life and movement.

Two years in and showing up to my mat with your voice guiding me is still a favourite part of my day. I have lost nearly 20 kg. I have become so much stronger and gained stamina. I now go on serious hiking, which is my next favourite activity after yoga. I have found back to my art and even had my first solo exhibition last fall, which did better that what I would ever imagine. I have found so many tools to deal with my chronic illness that I now feel certain that it will never ruin my life again. And I have found so much playfulness in my body that I have regained the childlike vigour that I honestly believe is a key to true happiness. All of this with your voice guiding me through.

I was so excited for this year's program that I dreamt about it all last night ğŸ¤£

Showing up today was hard. Really hard. I think I procrastinated for about an hour before taking the courage to lay down my mat and click play on the video. I've been doing yoga for 3 years now, but in 2020, and I don't think I was the only one, I fell into this deep state of pure anxiety/depression/panic, and I just couldn't bring myself to do anything that was good for me, including yoga. It's been at least 10 months since I got on the mat, and today I decided to help myself, and allow myself to feel something good after so many months of frustration. I actually injured my right wrist a few weeks ago, and I was a little scared of doing the practice, but how funny, I felt pain for a few moments and now, after completing the practice, it actually feels better (btw, if anyone has any tips for wrist injures, I accept them lol). Point is, if you've been away for a long time, like me, and is scared to get back into it, don't be. Take it easy and allow yourself to feel good :)

Deat Adriene, I first discovered your channel in the fall of 2019 while visiting my niece in North Carolina. I had just retired from a very demanding and high-stress career. I'm in my late 50s and I've always taken care of myself in order to stay healthy and strong. Your approach to yoga has opened up a whole new dimension and has added such a critical new component to my health regime. As I sit here, facing the wonderful and promising next chapters of my life, I actually have tears of gratitude streaming down my cheeks. Life has been a pretty incredible journey thus far, and the addition of your calming presence and guidance is equipping me to continue on this path of self-care, self-discovery, and self-enlightenment.  I just wish to thank you sincerely for the dedication you show your community. I can't begin to express the impact you've had on me in the last year since I've discovered your channel. You truly are a special soul and I'm so grateful to able to follow your guidance on my journey to becoming the best version of myself. Your channel is a big part of this journey, so thank you again...Namaste.

Heeyy to myself ^^ ~~
to be honest at first the 48 mins mark scared the shit out of me , but then this is Adriene i'm practicing with, and i know it's gonna be a fun ride, totally worth every second,

and not like i was doing some EXTRAORDINARY things with my time to begin with
in the contrary, i'll be doing myself a big favor by sticking to this journey ^_____^ i know it !! i'll stick to it this time for sure (insha-allah) , because, and even tho i'm ashamed to say it, i have tried the other journeys Adriene made for us, but i've always fell behind and end up not picking the mat, making myself sink a little further in disappointment in my own self , and losing other pieces of my confidence , which accumulates with other failures , and promises that i broke with myself , making me unconsciously believe that i'm just a full of talk loser, this despair will eventually blind my eyes towards other aspects of my life , where i shined brightly, where i stood up so strong, where i pulled myself together, it made me blind to the other hopeful and full of color parts of my life, it made me feel like my happiness is only in the faaaaaaaaaar future , which is so faaaaaaaaar that i won't even move to make it happen;

i won't let myself fall in that trap again, NEVER; since i decided , and i committed to prove to myself how much of an outstanding, incredible and full of miracles person that i am, ONLY if i gave myself the chance she NEEDS and the time it deserves to showcase that potential, to bring that future that seemed so far away right in front of her, right in from of YOU MERIEM ^^
and to your surprise Mereim , the JOURNEY is fun too ^__^ you gonna enjoy every step you take because it's for yourself , and because finally moving towards your dreams is so beautiful ^^ ~~

what if you fall you ask? well i'll pick you up right the next day, week or even two weeks, maybe even month, in the end that too is just part of the beautiful journey we embarked in, and in the future it'll make the picture even more beautiful and magical; look at all the failures i made up till now , do i hate them ? hell no , they were part of me , they make me , so what makes slacking a week any different than slacking for years ?? ... it's actually more reasonable to hold each others hand and get back to our journey , to the road to our beautiful future as quick , as determined and as happy and excited as possible ^^


So yeaah~~ i need to renew my commitment every day (as much as possible) , i need to show up on to the mat and commit to this journey full-heartedly, to see the " my self " the "Meriem" after this month who finished the whole journey , along side my other 2 commitments that i made with myself ( learning Graphic Design and Draw a box ) so then it'll be our 1st BIG step towards our dreams and our beautiful future

and what is better that having Adriene and all the other beautiful people towards the world that i know have similar and different reasons to show up to practice with me and with us, it's just the perfect recipe that anyone would ask for to get back on my dream's road :)

and i'm confident to say : " if it's me i know i can do it ; i will do it for me , i'll do it for you Meriem ; i'm my own hero , I'M YOUR HERO MERIEM, TRUST ME . "

so YEAAH!!~~ that was about it ^^ i'm so happy, excited and committed to show to myself how an incredible person i am, she is a strong BITCH !! LOL

Lastly, THANK YOU Adriene for giving me a chance, to at least show this type of commitment to myself, and a chance address this inner conflicts that i didn't really get to address .
i LOVE YOU SO MUCH and can't wait to practice with you, Namaste ~~ <3 .

That was FANTASTIC. I've been looking forward to doing a 30-day program "live" with you since I did Dedicate back in May. I was positively giddy for at least the first 7 minutes of the video, grinning from ear to ear. I have to say, I used to be a gymnast, so I'm no stranger to movement and stretching, and whenever I have stretched my wrists while on all fours it was always forward and backward and side to side. Doing it in a circular motion was a revelation. Can't wait to see what else I learn on this journey. THANK YOU ADRIENE. We are lucky to have you.

As a graphic designer, I also want to give a shoutout to the artist who designed the BREATH logo and selected (or perhaps even designed?) the font for the titles. It's so airy, simple, clean, and beautiful. What a wonderful job.

I spent most of yesterday feeling my entire back aching for some movement, after a considerable lack thereof the past few weeks, and slow and steady was just the ticket. I also surprised myself by how easy lowering to the belly from plank felt. My wrists felt surprisingly fine, until I did the self-massage and I notice a slight soreness on pressure. Gentle is the way forward.

But most importantly, I could feel my mind still. I've been easily annoyed and irritable lately, and coming back to the mat gave me the space to recognise, accept and let go.

Thank you for the invitation to go easy, I look forward to building the strength back up.

Inviting the listening.
I always do this short meditation right before a YWA video.
1- I sit cross legged breathing slow with eyes soft
2- list what each of my senses is perceiving.(outside)
3- then I scan my body for any physical sensations (inside)
4- then I scan my emotions and thoughts.(deeper inside).
5- based on my thoughts or emotions I then make my intention.
Todayâ€™s thoughts were â€œNew Years, gonna eliminate all the bad things and take on more good things- self work!!!! Self betterment!!!! Gonna be perfect!!!!â€
Intention- â€œslow down girl. Letâ€™s just be where we are. Be authentic.â€

19300 people did this practice at the same time as me... this is incredible. I am hugging you all!!!! <3 I did yoga with Adriene almost every day since March 2020 and something funny happened to me. 3 weeks ago I decided to go to a yoga studio for a beginners handstand workshop and I HATTTEEEED it so much... I suddenly felt so disconnected from my practice. It was so so physical, like every girl trying to achieve and do all these crazy asanas perfectly... and for me, yoga has a lot to do with spirituality, and with the fact it makes me connect with myself, and my body and my breath. And to accept me and my boundaries. Since then I felt so discouraged and I barely haven't practiced yoga. I was feeling pretty bad about it. So I want this journey to be a journey home again, to love yoga and overall, to love my practice and the way I understand yoga. I am excited. I love you Adriene. x

I also hated the first studio class I did because the type of yoga (Iengar yoga) was very demanding physically and not right for me. But then I tried other classes (mostly hatha yoga) and loved them. So dont be discouraged to try other classes. And the of course continue with adrienne at home ! :-)

I'm finally ready to work on my mental health and yoga is one of the things I am focusing on. I've done yoga casually the past few years, but never stuck with it long enough to see any results, and I was never in the headspace to care. But now as the depression fog lifts, I find myself wanting to feel strong instead of just saying I'm strong. This will be the first challenge I've been a part of as it happens and it will be the first challenge I intend to finish, and beyond.

I am grateful to you Adriene, Benji and the Find What Feels Good team, for creating a beautiful community for people and all the different challenges they face, to have a space to just be and feel some sense of peace. And have quite a few laughs along the way.

Here's to many more hey-ohs, full bottle experiences and baggy sweater love caves.

Namaste

Day 1: I have never done a yoga class before. Your channel was recommended in a newsletter from Caitlin DeSilva and I have always wanted to try yoga so I thought I would give this challenge a try. As a bigger person I couldn't touch my toes or the mat, I had a hard time being in the plank positions and nearly gave up twice. However, I promised myself I would commit this year, so I altered some movements to suit me and even looked to Benji to help me on this journey. Overall I committed, I didn't give up on this challenge and I didn't give up on myself and I'm so excited to continue my journey with you all.

Day 2: WHAT IS THIS! I woke up this morning in a Euphoric glow. I felt happy, confident in my body that normally feels like a prison. I was alert and focused and craving my workout and yoga class? Itâ€™s only day 2 but Iâ€™m sad when class ends. I still canâ€™t do most positions but Iâ€™m hooked. Iâ€™m already starting to crave tomorrowâ€™s class. Thankyou for this wonderful euphoric trance and newfound love for myself and my body.

Day 3: I did downward dog today, only for a second but I did it! I also held a plank for a second there as well, my hands are not hurting so bad when Iâ€™m on my hands and knees. Normally Iâ€™m in so much pain I have to check to see how long of class is left but I didnâ€™t check today, in fact I was actually disappointed when class was over. Iâ€™m so ecstatic for tomorrowâ€™s class, Iâ€™ve fallen in love.

I thought this would be a good, gentle intro into yoga, I enjoyed the lesson but I feel dizzy and nauseous. Any tips? I am 63, slim and healthy (at least, I think so!)
@Shannon Pitts Thanks, I am going to try evenings, that may suit me better, and drink more.  Thank you Shannon.

It could be a lot of things, but when that happens to me it's usually because I'm holding my breath or taking deeper breaths than my body is used to (when we're anxious we have a tendency to take quick shallow breaths, so forcing yourself to take deeper breaths is good, but your body may need to adjust....kind of like someone that's starving suddenly eating and then feeling sick afterwards). Also, are you drinking enough water throughout your day? You could be dehydrated. If you're doing this first thing in the morning, you might also need a small snack, like an apple and some nuts before practice. I also notice that if my sinuses are bothering me I have the dizzy/nausea feeling also. When that happens it's okay to not let your head hang down below your waste, but modify as needed. I hope that helps â¤ï¸

I've never been a "sportsy" person as a kid, at all. I hated sports. For the last five or so years, I started exercising in various ways, but nothing stuck with me for too long. I did go to a power yoga class at my uni for multiple semesters and liked it, although it often felt rushed, was only weekly, and felt boring to do by myself at home. Adriene changed this for me. Doing YWA for about a month and a half gave me so much! It's such a personal learning experience and growth both physically and mentally! I can't even stress how big of a role this plays for me mentally nowadays! Also, the fact that there are so many of us doing this together, plus all the uplifting commentary makes it feel so much nicer and personal! Thanks, Adriene and thanks to everyone else here! Wishing everyone the happiest year of 2021! Greetings from the Czech Republic.

Any Tipps for an absolute beginner with Bad mobility (its hard to follow instructions for me From a coordination point of view ) for me

Hi Relar! One of the most important things about a yoga practice is to meet yourself where you're at. So if you feel uncoordinated or unbalanced, just breathe and do what you can in the moment. This might mean doing a modification -- maybe you can't lift up your arm in the lunge today, and that's okay. The focus can be on putting less weight on the hand (instead of completely lifting it up), breathing, and keeping the core tight. Regardless of what Adriene is saying or doing in the video, first and foremost pay attention to what your body is telling you and find an alternative as you slowly build up strength and flexibility.

I felt so WHOLE during that final exhale. This is my third year in a row doing this challenge and not only am I blown away by how differently I am this year, mentally and physically, but also how deeply comforted I was by the thought of so many people around the world being with me at that moment. It's so easy to feel alone right now, even in a house full of people you love, especially when struggling with a mental illness that feels beyond me, but just the idea of having all of you with me for 30 days is truly magical. Sending lots of love, peace, and grace! Life and healing is a journey, just as this 30-day challenge will be. Thank you always, Adriene! You have changed so many of our lives and continuously do so - just by being YOU!

I'm normally not one to leave comments on videos, but I really wanted to thank you and Benji for getting me through 2020 and all of the covid madness! I'm a college student and last spring term was going to take yoga, but since we went remote, we were pretty much left to our own devices as far as finding activities that we would log in at the end of the week for class credit.  I struggled to find a yoga channel with a series that was simple, yet challenging for a somewhat beginner.  Your 30 day yoga journey for last year really helped me stay engaged, mindful, and on track. I learned so much and felt much more at home in my body. When I returned to campus and took a Hatha Yoga course, I could feel the muscle memory from the journey, feeling in shape and in control. Letting the breath do the work has really really stuck with me, and apply it to many areas of my life, even the non-physical! I just really wanted to thank you, and Benji too!

When I struggle with my depression I tell myself that it's okay. As long as I'm on the mat I can spend the whole session sitting or lying down and just breathe. I almost always end up doing at least a little neck stretching and a few cat-cows, because getting on the mat truly is the hardest part.

Like the others say, the most important thing to to focus on is just getting yourself on the mat and pressing play. I always remind myself that whatever happens after that is time well spent. You don't have to do all the moves 'perfectly' or exhaust yourself if you have no energy. Even if you're just breathing consciously in a restful position, you're doing something good for yourself :)

This is my tip! Line up the video the night before - set your alarm for a time when you can do this with no distractions and then just stumble out of bed and on to the mat. Don't use willpower - don't psyche yourself up - just get to the already set-up video and mat and just turn it on. Because you will lose willpower and motivation so you have to just trick yourself into getting there. And then just let Adriene take you through the process. Just allow it to happen - don't fight it, motion before emotion! But yes, set it all up in a way to let yourself win. You can do it! It's ONLY 30 days out of your whole life but it WILL change you in amazing ways. This is my 4th (or is it 5th??)  30 days challenge and they are incredible. Good luck!
You are in good hands, with lots of friends.  Make this a priority and you won't be sorry.  You can do it!

If you take a look, you'll see that in the short time it's been up there have already been over 7,000 people watching the video. Try to think about that, and how you may be doing it alone in your home but you are not alone while doing it!

Also, if I find that I'm exhausted or struggling mid-video, I allow myself the moment to settle into child's pose for long enough to catch my breath before moving on.
So ready to start this journey with you!
